introduction_explanation.text: Hello <name>, welcome to my kitchen! I hope you're ready to learn. This is the tutorial: here you'll learn how to play and the basics of pH.

instruction_explanation.text: When the messages have this color, it means you will have to follow an instruction for the experiment's sake

ph_first_explanation.text: pH is a property of solutions, like density, concentration or flammability

ph_first_question.text: Can you tell me what pH measures?

ph_first_question_explanation.text: pH measures the acidity of the solution on a scale from 0 to 14.

show_ph_scale.text: You can see the pH scale on the left.

explanation_29.text: pH measures the acidity of the solution on a scale from 0 to 14.

explanation_30.text: It is red cabbage! When you pour a solution in the bowl, you can use the scale to identify its pH value.

indicator_explanation.text: To measure pH we use an indicator, a substance that changes color according to the acidity of the solution.

indicator_question.text: Our indicator is the purple liquid you see in the bowls on the table. Do you know what it is?

indicator_question_explanation.text: It is red cabbage! When you pour a solution in the bowl, you can use the scale to identify its pH value.

practice_explanation.text: Welcome to practice Lesson. You can select item of your choice from the shelf.

ph_explanation.text: Scientists use something called a pH scale to measure how acidic or basic a liquid is. pH is a number from 0 to 14. From 0 to 7 are acids, with 0 being the strongest. From 7 to 14 are bases with 14 being the strongest base.

cabbage_solution_explanation.text: Cabbage solution is a pH indicator because it can tell us if a substance is acidic or basic by changing colour.

water_selection_explanation.text: Now select the last ingredient: water

collecting_items_answer.text: In the introduction part you have to collect 2 acidic elements and 2 basic, in the practice one you are free to bring whatever object you prefer to the table

acid_explanation.text: Whether a liquid is an acid or base depends on the type of ions in it. If it has a lot of hydrogen ions, then it is an acid. If it has a lot of hydroxide ions, then it is a base. Scientists use something called a pH scale to measure how acidic or basic a liquid is.

base_explanation.text: Basic substances contain lots of hydroxide ions. These are a different type of molecule with a small electrical charge. In foods, this means they will taste more bitter. Plenty of things other than food can be basic, however.

color_change_acid.text: Red cabbage contains a chemical called anthocyanin that changes color when it is mixed with an acid or a base. When the liquid is a red or purple color it means that it is more acidic. When the liquid is a blue, green, or yellow color it means that the liquid is more basic.

color_change_base.text: Red cabbage contains a chemical called anthocyanin that changes color when it is mixed with an acid or a base. When the liquid is a red or purple color it means that it is more acidic. When the liquid is a blue, green, or yellow color it means that the liquid is more basic.

color_change_neutral.text: Red cabbage contains a chemical called anthocyanin that changes color when it is mixed with an acid or a base. When the liquid is a red or purple color it means that it is more acidic. When the liquid is a blue, green, or yellow color it means that the liquid is more basic.

properties_acid_ingredient.text: Aqueous solutions of acids are electrolytes, meaning that they conduct electrical current. Some acids are strong electrolytes because they ionize completely in water, yielding a great many ions. Other acids are weak electrolytes that exist primarily in a non-ionized form when dissolved in water.
Acids have a sour taste. Lemons, vinegar, and sour candies all contain acids.

properties_neutral_ingredient.text: If a substance has a pH of exactly 7, it's neutral. This means it has equal amounts of hydrogen and hydroxide ions. Pure water is a neutral substance.

properties_base_ingredient.text: Bases taste bitter, feel slippery, and conduct electricity when dissolved in water. Indicator compounds such as litmus can be used to detect bases.

fallback.text: I am sorry, could you repeat? I was too focused on this beatiful cabbage solution

color_change_exclamation.text: You can see the colour of solution changed.

wrong_ph_identification.text: Not exactly, look closer at the color of the solution and try again

try_again.text: Do you want to give it another shot?

chatbot_appreciation.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

grant_points.text: Congrats you won 10 points. Click to Continue

practice_information.text: You can also check 3D animated molecular formula of items by clicking over them.

practice_reset.text: You can add new solution to check PH value by resetting the cabbage solution

end_experience.text: We did it, we completed the experiment! I am happy with your growth! Come back whenever you want to learn more about ph

practice_cycle_explanation.text: Here you can see all the selected items on the table. By clicking on the each items, you can mix it with the cabbage solution to check PH level.

next_step_introduction.text: You will need to select two acid items, and then click next

next_step_acid.text: After having selected two of the acid items of your choice just press next

next_step_ingredient_selection.text: Select all the ingredients on the shelves to continue

next_step_indicator_explanation.text: To carry on with the experiment tell me what you think about the indicator in the bowl

next_step_mix_strong_acid.text: Pour the lemon juice in the solution to go on

next_step_mix_strong_base.text: Pour the bath cleaner in the solution to go on

next_step_mix_water.text: Pour the water in the solution to go on

next_step_mix_weak_acid.text: Pour the milk in the solution to go on

next_step_explain_weak_acid.text: Tell me what you think about who is more acid between milk and lemon juice to continue

next_step_question_strong_acid.text: Click on the scale to identify the pH value of lemon juice

next_step_base.text: After having selected two of the basic items of your choice just press next

next_step_water.text: After having selected the water just press next

next_step_guided.text: After having poured all the items in the respective cabbage solution, you can click the practise lesson button to go on

next_step_practice_collecting.text: After having collected all the items of your choice you can press next

next_step_practice_cycle.text: You can either question me or answer the incoming questions, if i ask you a question answer the best way you can then pressing the continue button will make you go to the next phase

next_step_practice_information.text: You can reset the solution to try another time or you can wait for the end of the experience

explanation_0.text: Adding lemon juice will turn the solution light green

explanation_1.text: Adding cola will turn the solution light orange

explanation_2.text: Adding Baking soda will turn the solution purple

explanation_3.text: The element with ph 2 is lemon juice

explanation_4.text: The element with ph 7 is pure water

explanation_5.text: The item that has ph 3 is cola

explanation_6.text: The item which possess a ph of 6 is milk

explanation_7.text: The ingredient which has the ph of 13 is the bath cleaner

explanation_8.text: They are both acids, but one is more acidic than the other

explanation_9.text: One of the two is a base another is an acid

explanation_10.text: They are both bases but have different ph

explanation_11.text: Pure water is a neutral substance while baking soda is a base

explanation_12.text: Pure water is a neutral substance while vinegar is an acid one

explanation_13.text: Scientists use something called a pH scale to measure how acidic or basic a liquid is. pH is a number from 0 to 14. From 0 to 7 are acids, with 0 being the strongest. From 7 to 14 are bases with 14 being the strongest base.

explanation_14.text: Cabbage solution is a pH indicator because it can tell us if a substance is acidic or basic by changing colour.

explanation_15.text: The pH for lemon juice is 2

explanation_17.text: Milk has a pH value of 6.

explanation_35.text: Milk has a pH value of 6.

explanation_31.text: Lemon juice is an acid substance

next_step_practice_start.text: Press the next button to proceed

next_step_collect_substances.text: Select the substance you wish to identify to proceed

next_step_identify_ph.text: Identify the pH of the substance you selected earlier. The one displayed here on my right.

general_ph_property_explanation.text: Scientists use something called a pH scale to measure how acidic or basic a liquid is. pH is a number from 0 to 14. From 0 to 7 are acids, with 0 being the strongest. From 7 to 14 are bases with 14 being the strongest base.

acid_color_change_explanation.text: Purple cabbage juice turns red when it mixes with something acidic

base_color_change_explanation.text: Purple cabbage juice turns green when it mixes with something basic

neutral_color_change_explanation.text: A neutral substance does not trigger a color change in the cabbage solution

ingredient_color_change_explanation.text: Purple cabbage juice turns red when it mixes with something acidic and green when it mixes with something basic.A neutral substance does not trigger a color change.

acid_ingredient_explanation.text: A solution with a sour-taste and low pH value.

base_ingredient_explanation.text: A solution with a sweet taste and high pH value.

neutral_ingredient_explanation.text: A neutral substance has a ph of 7 hence it is neither acid nor basic

general_ingredient_explanation.text: An acid is a solution with a sour-taste and low pH value. A base is asolution with a sweet taste and high pH value.A neutral substance has a ph of 7 hence it is neither acid nor basic

ph_cabbage_solution_explanation.text: Cabbage Solution is at about pH 7.

inform_every_liq_ph_explanation.text: Most definitely, if you have a liquid you want to measure the pH of try making the cabbage solution at home!

inform_why_not_item_mixed_explanation.text: You can mix the items, but the ph level will not be consistent, because the mixing of items changes the ph value of the mixtures depending on the specific item properties and quantities.

inform_other_way_to_measure_ph_explanati.text: Any other indicator can help you in measuring pH, even tea can be an indicator. Scientist use a specific type of paper: litmus paper!

inform_cabbage_at_home_explanation.text: Yes you have to blend the purple cabbage in the mixer or blender and extract the juice, remember to ask for an adult for help.

inform_ph_change_on_item_measure_explana.text: Yes, it changes, but it does not change linearly, so directly averaging them doesn't give correct values

inform_why_only_these_select_explanation.text: Following the experiment you will be able to learn the most about pH.

inform_why_this_test_explanation.text: It is the experiment to learn the PH level. With PH level you can understand the concept of acidic and basic

inform_collecting_items_explanation.text: You will be able to use all the items that you see in front of you!

mix_strong_acid_question.text: Wow, it turned red! Try to identify the pH value on the scale and click to select it.

mix_strong_acid_second_question.text: Do you think the lemon juice is an acid or not?

tricky_scale.text: The pH scale is tricky: the lower the value the higher the acidity.

mix_strong_base_question.text: Wow, it turned green! Try to identify the pH value on the scale and click to select it.

mix_water_explanation.text: Now try to pour the water

neutral_explanation.text: Being in the middle, water is neither acid, nor alkaline: we say it is neutral.

milk_or_lemon_juice_explanation.text: Milk is closer to 7, it means it's a weaker acid. Lemon juice is closer to 0 whih means it is a stronger acid

mix_strong_acid_question_explanation.text: The pH for lemon juice is 2.

mix_strong_base_question_explanation.text: Lemon juice and bath cleaner have a lot of differences. To explain the properties of substances scientist introduced the concept of pH

mix_weak_acid_question_explanation.text: See lemon juice and milk are both acids, but lemon juice has a way lower pH value. Hence the colors are similar but have different shades.

mix_strong_acid_explanation.text: The bowls on the counter are filled with a purple solution. What do you think they are filled with?

alkaline_explanation.text: When pH is between 8 and 14, we say the solution is alkaline.
